coref: A Fox fell into a well, and though it was not very deep, A Fox found that A Fox could not get out again. After A Fox had been in a well a long time, a thirsty Goat came by. a thirsty Goat thought A Fox A Fox had gone down to drink, and so a thirsty Goat asked if the water was good. The finest in the whole country, said A FoxA Fox, jump in and try it, There is more than enough for both of us. a thirsty Goat immediately jumped in and began to drink. A Fox A Fox just as quickly jumped on a thirsty Goat's back and leaped from the tip of a thirsty Goat's horns out of a well. a thirsty Goat a thirsty Goat now saw what a plight a thirsty Goat had got into, and begged A Fox A Fox to help a thirsty Goat out. But A Fox Fox was already on A Fox way to the woods. If you had as much sense as you have beard, old fellow, A Fox said as A Fox ran, you would have been more cautious about finding a way to get out again before you jumped in.
